abstract_summ: The aim of this study was to evaluate the association of COVID-19 factors and psychological factors with psychological distress among dental staff during the COVID-19 pandemic outbreak.The purpose of this study was to evaluate the levels of depression, anxiety and health anxiety in Turkish society during the COVID-19 pandemic, and to examine the factors affecting these.Results revealed that elevated psychological distress was found among those who have background illness, fear of contracting COVID-19 from patient, and a higher subjective overload.Variables considered were sociodemographic variables, physical symptoms, health conditions, COVID-19 contact history and psychological adjustment.The aim of the study is to analyse psychological distress during the COVID-19 pandemic.
title_summ: Emotional distress and associated sociodemographic risk factors during the COVID-19 outbreak in Spain[Psychopathological symptoms during Covid-19 quarantine in spanish general population: a preliminary analysis based on sociodemographic and occupational-contextual factors.]Prevalence, risk factors and clinical correlates of depression in quarantined population during the COVID-19 outbreakCOVID-19 Factors and Psychological Factors Associated with Elevated Psychological Distress among Dentists and Dental Hygienists in IsraelRelated Health Factors of Psychological Distress During the COVID-19 Pandemic in SpainLevels and predictors of anxiety, depression and health anxiety during COVID-19 pandemic in Turkish society: The importance of gender.
title_abstract_phrases: Nonetheless, the high prevalence of emotional symptoms and disorders in this sample suggests that mental health interventions are urgently needed in Spain.[Psychopathological symptoms during Covid-19 quarantine in spanish general population: a preliminary analysis based on sociodemographic and occupational-contextual factors.]OBJECTIVE Coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic disease forced different countries to adopt quarantine measures.The purpose of this study was to evaluate the levels of depression, anxiety and health anxiety in Turkish society during the COVID-19 pandemic, and to examine the factors affecting these.COVID-19 Factors and Psychological Factors Associated with Elevated Psychological Distress among Dentists and Dental Hygienists in IsraelThe aim of this study was to evaluate the association of COVID-19 factors and psychological factors with psychological distress among dental staff during the COVID-19 pandemic outbreak.Emotional distress and associated sociodemographic risk factors during the COVID-19 outbreak in SpainBackground Spain is one of the countries that has been most affected by COVID-19 disease.Variables considered were sociodemographic variables, physical symptoms, health conditions, COVID-19 contact history and psychological adjustment.
